result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett A Haggerty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. Complete anger management and psychological evaluation and treatment. No contact with R.P.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - DNA taken

Defendant, Brett A Haggerty, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the right to an attorney. Defendant waived attorney. Rights & elements recited. Defendant plead no contest to count 2. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 1 yr. probation, conds: Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. Complete anger management and psychological evaluation and treatment. No contact with R.P. $543 costs. No jail credit. Ct. 1 read in and dismissed.
from Atty Cross for Atty Genda to Columbia County Sheriff's Dept re: cancellation of warrant

Defendant, Brett A Haggerty, appeared pro se, made statement regarding missed appearance. Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant quashed. Bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
